thread.title: Front Burner: Tzatziki, Skordalia and Other Greek Dips Bring the Taverna Home
thread.title_full: Front Burner: Tzatziki, Skordalia and Other Greek Dips Bring the Taverna Home

author: FLORENCE FABRICANT
title: Front Burner: Tzatziki, Skordalia and Other Greek Dips Bring the Taverna Home

organizations.name: redit tony cenicola/the new york times meals

text: Continue reading the main story Photo A new line of dips from the chef and restaurateur Maria Loi. Credit Tony Cenicola/The New York Times Meals at many Greek restaurants start with bowls of tangy, garlicky dips and spreads like tzatziki. This new line from Maria Loi, the chef and restaurateur, takes Greek dips beyond the everyday. Her smoked eggplant has a garlicky kick and is lighter than most. A dollop of her skordalia, a pur√©e of potato and garlic, will elevate mashed potatoes. The unusual pougi is a tangy, lightly spiced mix of yogurt and feta. And tzatziki with cucumber, yogurt and garlic has a fresh, crunchy texture: Loi Dips, $6.99 for eight ounces at Whole Foods M arkets.
